docs.snippet: Efrem Zimbalist, a violinist celebrated for his assured technique, intelligent musicianship and patrician bearing in a career that spanned more than half a century, died Friday morning in Reno. He was 94 years old.     Mr. Zimbalist, along with Ja...
docs.lead_paragraph: Efrem Zimbalist, a violinist celebrated for his assured technique, intelligent musicianship and patrician bearing in a career that spanned more than half a century, died Friday morning in Reno. He was 94 years old. Mr. Zimbalist, along with Jascha Heifetz, Mischa Elman and Nathan Milstein, was one of the distinguished alumni of Leopold Auer's legendary violin classes in Czarist St. Petersburg. From his first American appearance in 1911 - when he played the United States premiere of Alexander Glazunov's ''Concerto in A minor'' with the Boston Symphony Orchestra - until his retirement from the concert stage more than 40 years later, Mr. Zimbalist was acclaimed by colleagues, critics and the general public as one of the most respected musical figures of his time.

docs.snippet: Guatemalans will elect a civilian President and members of Congress on Oct. 24, and the nation's military chiefs will hand over power on Jan. 14, 1986, the Government announced today.    Gen. Oscar Humberto Mejiia Victores, Guatemala's chief of st...
docs.lead_paragraph: Guatemalans will elect a civilian President and members of Congress on Oct. 24, and the nation's military chiefs will hand over power on Jan. 14, 1986, the Government announced today. Gen. Oscar Humberto Mejiia Victores, Guatemala's chief of state, the Supreme Electoral Tribunal and the National Constituent Assembly announced the election plan in a joint statement.

docs.snippet: A Federal jury today convicted a leader in the movement to provide sanctuary to Latin American aliens.   Jack Elder, who is director of the Casa Oscar Romero shelter in San Benito, Tex., was found guilty of conspiracy, of helping two Salvadorans e...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Federal jury today convicted a leader in the movement to provide sanctuary to Latin American aliens. Jack Elder, who is director of the Casa Oscar Romero shelter in San Benito, Tex., was found guilty of conspiracy, of helping two Salvadorans enter the United States illegally, and of driving two aliens from the Mexican border to the shelter. A co-defendant, Stacey Lynn Merkt, was found guilty of one count of conspiracy but not guilty of two counts of transporting two illegal aliens.

headline.main: LEADER IN MOVEMENT TO HARBOR ALIENS IS CONVICTED

docs.snippet: 1.*Tropical Dressing It may be February but the fashion world is thinking about the tropics, with all manner of exotic prints and patterns. One example: a long black cotton dress appliqued with a brightly colored parrot on the yoke. Wear the dress...
docs.lead_paragraph: 1.*Tropical Dressing It may be February but the fashion world is thinking about the tropics, with all manner of exotic prints and patterns. One example: a long black cotton dress appliqued with a brightly colored parrot on the yoke. Wear the dress for entertaining at home or for dinner at a beach resort. Designed by Oscar de la Renta for Swirl, it is $64 in the loungewear department on the second floor at Altman's. 2.For Camera Fiends Know a teen-ager who likes cameras? She might also like this camera- shaped shoulder bag to carry her lunch to school or her sunglasses and lotion to the beach, come summer. The body of the camera is black, the see-through lens and strap come in orange, green, blue or yellow, and a sliding door in back allows access to the contents. The bag sells for $12.50 at Stephen Anson, 1058 First Avenue (between 57th and 58th Streets). 3.A Robot for Neatness The robot with a heart is actually a child-size shoe bag that should encourage neatness, for what youngster could resist putting away shoes in one of its six compartments? The red heart and lips stand out against a blue body with white hands, feet and antennae. The fabric is a blend of polyester and cotton lined with polyester batting. Made by Fanny's Play House, it costs $24 at Little Senli, 30 Rockefeller Plaza and 672 Lexington Avenue (near 56th Street). 4.

headline.main: FOR THINKING TROPICAL AND GOING TO THE BEACH

docs.snippet: Jury selection began today in the trial of two people accused of smuggling Central American aliens into this country.    Federal District Judge Filemon Vela of Brownsville summoned a panel of 80 prospective jurors. When he asked if any had seen, h...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jury selection began today in the trial of two people accused of smuggling Central American aliens into this country. Federal District Judge Filemon Vela of Brownsville summoned a panel of 80 prospective jurors. When he asked if any had seen, heard or read news reports of the case, 33 raised their hands. They were questioned separately.

headline.main: TWO GO ON TRIAL IN HOUSTON FOR ILLEGALLY HELPING ALIENS

docs.snippet: Penny Cooper often dreams about the future. By dawn her mind has conjured up things that might be around in the 21st century - diagonal elevators, for instance. Usually she shrugs them off as impractical.   One night in 1982, however, she had a dr...
docs.lead_paragraph: Penny Cooper often dreams about the future. By dawn her mind has conjured up things that might be around in the 21st century - diagonal elevators, for instance. Usually she shrugs them off as impractical. One night in 1982, however, she had a dream that did not fade away. Mrs. Cooper envisioned herself eating beef stew concocted from a dehydrated food sample enclosed in a plastic pouch that came in a magazine.

docs.snippet: ON ''Wear Red Day'' at Alumni Hall yesterday, the St. John's spectators responded. They wore red blazers and red dresses, red sweaters and red skirts, red pants and red blouses, red ties and red hats, red socks and red shoes. And by halftime, even...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON ''Wear Red Day'' at Alumni Hall yesterday, the St. John's spectators responded. They wore red blazers and red dresses, red sweaters and red skirts, red pants and red blouses, red ties and red hats, red socks and red shoes. And by halftime, even Chris Mullin was wearing something red - a red face. Or at least as red as his pasty white complexion will ever get. As he walked into the locker room at halftime, Chris Mullin had made only 2 of his 10 shots from the floor, missing his last 7 shots. Including 3 foul shots, the all- American and Olympic gold medalist had scored only 7 points as No. 1-ranked St. John's was losing to DePaul, 38- 34.

docs.snippet: Of the 20 acting nominations in this year's Academy Award race, the nomination of Jeff Bridges as best actor was the biggest surprise.   Critics had appreciated Mr. Bridges' performance as an awkward alien trying to get comfortable in a recently a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Of the 20 acting nominations in this year's Academy Award race, the nomination of Jeff Bridges as best actor was the biggest surprise. Critics had appreciated Mr. Bridges' performance as an awkward alien trying to get comfortable in a recently acquired human body in ''Starman.'' But any number of critically praised performances were not nominated - including Jack Lemmon's soothing priest in ''Mass Appeal,'' Robert Redford's aging baseball player in ''The Natural,'' and Matthew Modine and Nicolas Cage as friends helping each other battle insanity in ''Birdie.'' Nor was Steve Martin nominated for his performance as a different kind of creature - a man sharing his body with a woman in ''All of Me'' - despite Mr. Martin's awards as best actor from two major groups of critics. There is no assembly line capable of making keys that will unlock the Academy door. But, according to a number of Hollywood publicists, there are necessary elements that will help the keys to fit. ''You have to build momentum with an actor or actress so the person seems always to have been there,'' said one publicist who asked not to be identified. ''I open doors and some actors sail right through them. But if a person's a dud, he's a dud.''

headline.main: ACCESSIBILITY IS A HELP IN THE RACE FOR AN OSCAR
